kou commented on pull request #5713: ARROW-6962: [C++] [CI] Stop compiling with -Weverything
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5713#discussion_r337763089
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/SetupCxxFlags.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -100,9 +100,8 @@ endif()
 # BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL add warning/error compiler flags. The possible values are
 # - PRODUCTION: Build with `-Wall` but do not add `-Werror`, so warnings do not
 #   halt the build.
-# - CHECKIN: Imply `-Weverything` with certain pedantic warnings
-#   disabled. `-Werror` is added in debug builds so that any warnings fail the
-#   build
+# - CHECKIN: Build with `-Wall` (and `-Werror` in debug mode so that any
 
 Review comment:
   Could you add `-Wextra` here too?

wesm commented on issue #5713: ARROW-6962: [C++] [CI] Stop compiling with -Weverything
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5713#issuecomment-545671702
 
 
   If we aren't using `-Weverything`, then we probably don't need to have a long list of disabled warnings. 
   
   Does `-Wall` on clang catch missing virtual destructors? We may need to opt in to some of the warnings that we care about.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
